summary.long: 2 Timothy is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To Timothy, my beloved son:
Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I thank God, whom I serve with a pure conscience as my forefathers did, as I continually remember you in my prayers night and day,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: greatly desiring to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: remembering the genuine faith that first lived in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice and that I am persuaded lives in you also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I remind you to stir up the gift of God, which is in you by the laying on of my hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God has not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, and love, and self-control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not be ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me, His prisoner. But share in the sufferings of the gospel by the power of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has saved us and called us with a holy calling, not by our works, but by His own purpose and grace, which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but is now revealed by the appearing of our Savior, Jesus Christ, who has abolished death and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for which I was appointed a preacher, an apostle, and a teacher of the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things I suffer, but I am not ashamed, for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that He is able to keep that which I have committed to Him until that Day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Follow the pattern of sound teaching which you have heard from me in the faith and love that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Guard the treasure that was committed to you through the Holy Spirit who lives in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that all those who are in Asia have turned away from me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he arrived in Rome, he searched me out very diligently and found me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the Lord grant that he may find mercy from the Lord on that Day. You know very well how many ways he ministered to me at Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Share the things that you have heard from me in the presence of many witnesses with faithful men who will be able to teach others also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Endure hard times as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No soldier on active duty entangles himself with civilian affairs, that he may please the enlisting officer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who competes as an athlete is not rewarded without competing legally.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The farmer who labors should be first to partake of the crops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider what I am saying, and may the Lord grant you understanding in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, descended from David, according to my gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which I suffer trouble like a criminal, even with chains. But the word of God is not bound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is a faithful saying:
If we die with Him,
    we shall also live with Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we endure,
    we shall also reign with Him.
If we deny Him,
    He also will deny us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Remind them of these things, commanding them before the Lord that they not argue about words, which leads to nothing of value and to the destruction of those who hear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Study to show yourself approved by God, a workman who need not be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid profane foolish babblings, for they will increase to more ungodliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their word will spread like gangrene: Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection has already occurred, and who overthrow the faith of some.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the firm foundation of God stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are His,” and, “Let everyone who calls on the name of Christ depart from iniquity.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a large house there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also those of wood and clay; some are for honor, and some for dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One who cleanses himself from these things will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, fit for the Master’s use, and prepared for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So flee youthful desires and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace, with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid foolish and unlearned debates, knowing that they create strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The servant of the Lord must not quarrel, but must be gentle toward all people, able to teach, patient,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in gentleness instructing those in opposition. Perhaps God will grant them repentance to know the truth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they may escape from the snare of the devil, after being captured by him to do his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Know this: In the last days perilous times will come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without natural affection, trucebreakers, slanderers, unrestrained, fierce, despisers of those who are good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: traitors, reckless, conceited, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a form of godliness, but denying its power. Turn away from such people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those of this nature creep into houses and captivate silly women who are burdened with sins and led away with various desires,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: always learning, but never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Jannes and Jambres resisted Moses, so these also resist the truth, men of corrupt minds and worthless concerning the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shall proceed no further, for their folly will be revealed to everyone, as theirs also was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have observed my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, tolerance, love, patience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecutions, and afflictions, which came to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra—what persecutions I endured! But the Lord delivered me out of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, and all who desire to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But evil men and seducers will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But continue in the things that you have learned and have been assured of, knowing those from whom you have learned them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that since childhood you have known the Holy Scriptures, which are able to make you wise unto salvation through the faith that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All Scripture is inspired by God and is profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I charge you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at His appearing and His kingdom:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Preach the word, be ready in season and out of season, reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time will come when people will not endure sound doctrine, but they will gather to themselves teachers in accordance with their own desires, having itching ears,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will turn their ears away from the truth and turn to myths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But be self-controlled in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, and prove your ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I am already being poured out as a drink offering, and the time of my departure has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, and I have kept the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on a crown of righteousness is laid up for me, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will give me on that Day, and not only to me but also to all who have loved His appearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Diligently try to come to me soon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Demas has forsaken me, having loved this present world, and has departed to Thessalonica, Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark, and bring him with you, for he is profitable to me for the ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you come, bring with you the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus, and the books, but especially the parchments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil. May the Lord reward him according to his works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware of him, for he has greatly opposed our words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At my first defense no one stood with me, but everyone forsook me. May it not be charged against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord stood with me and strengthened me, so that through me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear. And I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord will deliver me from every evil work and will preserve me for His heavenly kingdom, to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Erastus remained at Corinth, and I have left Trophimus ill in Miletus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Diligently try to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
